author: Megan Ellis
title: Kruger rangers nab eight poachers
text:
Kruger rangers nab eight poachers Article By: Megan Ellis Fri, 07 Aug 2015 8:27 AM Share Your Email Two white rhinos grazing. Credit: AFP 
Rangers in the Kruger National Park have been praised for catching eight suspected poachers in just 24 hours. 
The poachers were arrested in two incidents on Wednesday. 
"In the first incident in the early hours of Wednesday rangers conducting anti-poaching operations encountered three suspected poachers along the Crocodile River - south of the Park," SANParks said in a statement. 
A shootout between rangers and the suspected poachers then broke out, with one poacher being wounded. 
The three suspects were then arrested. They were found in possession of two hunting rifles, silencers, ammunition and other poaching equipment. 
Later in the day on Wednesday, a joint operation between SANParks Rangers and the SAPS resulted in five more suspects being arrested. 
"This brings to eight the number of arrests in the last 24 hours," SANParks said. 
The rangers and the SAPS were praised by Minister of Environmental Affairs Edna Molewa. 
"This is a clear indication that resilience and dedication pays offâ€¦ we are grateful that no lives were lost," she said. Read More
